rawKJV: Who against hope believed in hope, that he might become the father of many nations, according to that which was spoken, So shall thy seed be.

rawKJV: I speak after the manner of men because of the infirmity of your flesh: for as ye have yielded your members servants to uncleanness and to iniquity unto iniquity; even so now yield your members servants to righteousness unto holiness.

rawKJV: So then if, while her husband liveth, she be married to another man, she shall be called an adulteress: but if her husband be dead, she is free from that law; so that she is no adulteress, though she be married to another man.
grebrew: Ἄρα οὖν ζῶντος τοῦ ἀνδρὸς, μοιχαλὶς χρηματίσει: ἐὰν, γένηται ἀνδρὶ ἑτέρῳ, ἐὰν δὲ ἀποθάνῃ ὁ ἀνήρ, ἐλευθέρα ἐστὶν ἀπὸ τοῦ νόμου· τοῦ μὴ εἶναι αὐτὴν μοιχαλίδα, γενομένην ἀνδρὶ ἑτέρῳ.

rawKJV: But sin, taking occasion by the commandment, wrought in me all manner of concupiscence. For without the law sin was dead.

rawKJV: I thank God through Jesus Christ our Lord. So then with the mind I myself serve the law of God; but with the flesh the law of sin.
grebrew: Ἐυχάριστῶ τῷ Θεῷ διὰ Ἰησοῦ Χριστοῦ τοῦ Κυρίου ἡμῶν. Ἄρα οὖν αὐτὸς ἐγὼ τῷ μὲν νοῒ δουλεύω νόμῳ Θεοῦ· τῇ δὲ σαρκὶ νόμῳ ἁμαρτίας.

rawFirstEdition: NEwutche yeuyeu matta nag ‹awakompanàog› ‹apéhtauóncheg› Christ Jesus: matta nag «asukomògig» weyaus, qut asukauóncheg Nashauanitto.
rawSecondEdition: Newutche yeuyeu matta nag awakompanáog ‹apéhtauoncheg› Christ Jesus: matta nag «asuhkomógig» weyaus, qut asukauóncheg Nashauanitto.

rawKJV: There is therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus, who walk «not» after the flesh, but after the Spirit.

rawFirstEdition: Newutche «wuttinaumatuonk» pomantamóe Nashauanitto ut Christ Jesus, «nuppohquohhunuk» wutch wuttinnaumatuonganit matcheseonk kah nuppꝏ̄onk.
rawSecondEdition: Newutche wuttinnaumatuonk «pomnntamóe» Nashauanitto ut Christ Jesus, nuppohquohwhunuk wutch wuttinnaumatuonganit matcheseonk kah nuppꝏ̄onk.

rawKJV: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus hath made me free from the law of sin and death.
grebrew: Ὁ γὰρ νόμος τοῦ Πνεύματος τῆς ζωῆς ἐν Χριστῷ Ἰησοῦ ἠλευθέρωσέν με ἀπὸ τοῦ νόμου τῆς ἁμαρτίας καὶ τοῦ θανάτου.

rawFirstEdition: Newutche ne «naumatŭonk» matta aseik, newutche nꝏ̄chumwi nashpe weyaus: God anꝏ̄nont nehenwonche wunnaumónuh; ut «ogquneongqussuonganit» «matcheetupanatamwe» weyausut, kah nashpe sephausuonk wutche matcheséonk, ‹awakómpanau› match[e]séonk ut weyausut.
rawSecondEdition: Newutche ne naumatuonk matta aseik, newutche nꝏ̄chumwi nashpe weyaus; God anꝏ̄nont nehenwonche Wunnaumonuh; ut «ogqunneongqussuonganit» «matchetupana[t]amwe» weyausut, kah nashpe «saphaus[u]onk» wutche matcheseonk, awakompanau matcheseonk ut weyausut,

rawKJV: For what the law could «not» do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh, and for sin, condemned sin in the flesh:
grebrew: Τὸ γὰρ ἀδύνατον τοῦ νόμου, ἐν ᾧ ἠσθένει διὰ τῆς σαρκός, ὁ Θεὸς τὸν ἑαυτοῦ Υἱὸν πέμψας ἐν ὁμοιώματι σαρκὸς ἁμαρτίας, καὶ περὶ ἁμαρτίας, κατέκρινεν τὴν ἁμαρτίαν ἐν τῇ σαρκί:

rawFirstEdition: Naumatue wunnomwayeuonk onk woh pakodche n$nih ut kuhhogkanónut. Matta asuhkomꝏ̄og weyaus qut asuhkauogkut Nashauanit.

rawKJV: And if some of the branches be broken off, and thou, being «a» wild olive tree, wert graffed in among them, and with them partakest of the root and fatness of the olive tree;

rawKJV: Behold therefore the goodness and severity of God: on them which fell, severity; but toward thee, goodness, if thou continue in his goodness: otherwise thou also shalt be cut off.

rawFirstEdition: Kah nag wonk, matta «nagwutteanumóhetteg» ‹uppannꝏ̄wóhtamꝏ̄onganꝏ̄›, nag pish ne ponóneau: newutche God tápenum wonk na upponónat.

rawKJV: For I would «not», brethren, that ye should be ignorant of this mystery, lest ye should be wise in your own conceits; that blindness in part is happened to Israel, until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in.

rawKJV: Let every soul be subject unto the higher powers. For there is no power but of God: the powers that be are ordained of God.

rawKJV: Whosoever therefore resisteth the power, resisteth the ordinance of God: and they that resist shall receive to themselves damnation.

rawKJV: For rulers are «not» «a» terror to good works, but to the evil. Wilt thou then «not» be afraid of the power? do that which is good, and thou shalt have praise of the same:
grebrew: Οἱ γὰρ ἄρχοντες οὐκ εἰσὶν φόβος τῶν ἀγαθῶν ἔργων, ἀλλὰ τῶν κακῶν. Θέλεις δὲ μὴ φοβεῖσθαι τὴν ἐξουσίαν; τὸ ἀγαθὸν ποίει, καὶ ἕξεις ἔπαινον ἐξ αὐτῆς:

rawFirstEdition:
Newutche neh wuttinnumoh wutche ken, wutche wanégik: qut ussean ne ‹màchuk›, wabesish, newutche matta tahnꝏ̄che tohshinnumꝏ̄ togkodteg: newutche neh wuttinnúmoh God: «anꝏ̄toánshuhkeaénin», wussokanumauun musquanitteáonk neh «machesénutcheh.
»

grebrew: Θεοῦ γὰρ διάκονός ἐστίν σοι εἰς τὸ ἀγαθόν. Ἐὰν δὲ τὸ κακὸν ποιῇς, φοβοῦ· οὐ γὰρ εἰκῆ τὴν μάχαιραν φορεῖ: Θεοῦ γὰρ διάκονός ἐστιν, ἔκδικος εἰς ὀργὴν τῷ τὸ κακὸν πράσσοντι.

rawKJV: For this, Thou shalt «not» commit adultery, Thou shalt «not» kill, Thou shalt «not» steal, Thou shalt «not» bear false witness, Thou shalt «not» covet; and if there be any other commandment, it is briefly comprehended in this saying, namely, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.
grebrew: Τὸ γάρ, Οὐ μοιχεύσεις, Οὐ φονεύσεις, Οὐ κλέψεις, Οὐ ψευδομαρτυρήσεις, Οὐκ ἐπιθυμήσεις· καὶ εἴ τις ἑτέρα ἐντολή, ἐν τούτῳ τῷ λόγῳ ἀνακεφαλαιοῦται, ἐν τῷ, Ἀγαπήσεις τὸν πλησίον σου ὡς ἑαυτόν.

rawKJV: So then every one of us shall give account of himself to God.
grebrew: Ἄρα οὖν ἕκαστος ἡμῶν περὶ ἑαυτοῦ λόγον δώσει τῷ Θεῷ.

rawKJV: Let us «not» therefore judge one another any more: but judge this rather, that no man put «a» stumblingblock or an occasion to fall in his brother's way.
grebrew: Μηκέτι οὖν ἀλλήλους κρίνωμεν: ἀλλὰ τοῦτο κρίνατε μᾶλλον, τὸ μὴ τιθέναι πρόσκομμα τῷ ἀδελφῷ ἢ σκάνδαλον.

rawKJV: I know, and am persuaded by the Lord Jesus, that there is nothing unclean of itself: but to him that esteemeth any thing to be unclean, to him it is unclean.
grebrew: Οἶδα, καὶ πέπεισμαι ἐν Κυρίῳ Ἰησοῦ, ὅτι οὐδὲν κοινὸν διʼ ἑαυτοῦ: εἰ μὴ τῷ λογιζομένῳ τι κοινὸν εἶναι, ἐκείνῳ κοινόν.

grebrew: Ἡ χάρις τοῦ Κυρίου ἡμῶν Ἰησοῦ Χριστοῦ μετὰ πάντων ὑμῶν. Ἀμήν.

rawFirstEdition: Wonk, noh tapenuk ‹kummenuhkéhukqunnaóut›, neaunag nꝏ̄nsittongquottꝏ̄m, & kuhkꝏ̄tomuhkonat Jesus Christ; neyane woshwunnumuk ne siohkok, ne keme wadchanumukup wutúhshit muttaohke kadshik.

rawKJV: Now to him that is of power to stablish you according to my gospel, and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery, which was kept secret since the world began,
grebrew: Τῷ δὲ δυναμένῳ ὑμᾶς στηρίξαι κατὰ τὸ εὐαγγέλιόν μου, καὶ τὸ κήρυγμα Ἰησοῦ Χριστοῦ, κατὰ ἀποκάλυψιν μυστηρίου, χρόνοις αἰωνίοις, σεσιγημένου,

rawFirstEdition: Qut yeuyeu wahteauwahuwon, «nash[q]e» «wussukkuhwhosuonganꝏ̄oash» negonne missohhamwáenúog, ‹neánanꝏ̄teamwit› ‹machémapit› God, wahteauwáhuwon ut wame ‹wutóhtimoneat›: wutche nꝏ̄sweetamꝏ̄weu wunnamptamꝏ̄onk.
rawSecondEdition: Qut yeuyeu wahteauwahuwon, nashpe «wussukwhosuonganꝏ̄oash» negonne missohhamwaenúog, ‹neananꝏ̄teamwit› michemapit God, wahteauwahuwon ut wame wutohtimoneat: wutche nꝏ̄sweetamꝏ̄weu wunnamptamꝏ̄onk.

rawKJV: But now is made manifest, and by the scriptures of the prophets, according to the commandment of the everlasting God, made known to all nations for the obedience of faith:
grebrew: Φανερωθέντος δὲ νῦν, διά τε γραφῶν προφητικῶν, κατʼ ἐπιταγὴν τοῦ αἰωνίου Θεοῦ, εἰς ὑπακοὴν πίστεως εἰς πάντα τὰ ἔθνη γνωρισθέντος:

rawFirstEdition: God nont waantam sohsumꝏ̄onaj nashpe Jesus Christ, micheme. Amen.
rawSecondEdition: God nont waantam sohsumꝏ̄onaj nashpe Jesus C[h]rist, m[i]cheme. Amen.

rawKJV: To God only wise, be glory through Jesus Christ for ever. Amen.
grebrew: Μόνῳ σοφῷ Θεῷ, διὰ Ἰησοῦ Χριστοῦ ἡ δόξα εἰς τοὺς αἰῶνας. Ἀμήν.
